content.webTitle: Company moves in to buy Watergate storeys

fields.headline: Company moves in to buy Watergate storeys
fields.bodyText: The Watergate office building, site of the infamous 1972 burglary that led to the downfall of Richard Nixon, has been sold. BentleyForbes, a property company, has paid $86.5m (£49.2m) for the 11-storey office building and nearby shopping area. The burglary of the Democratic National Committee office led to congressional hearings, prosecution of Nixon aides and, eventually, Nixon's resignation in 1974. "We think it's a unique asset with an interesting history and with a stable income in a unique location," David Cobb, head of BentleyForbes, told the Washington Post.
